Class ReinforcementLearningUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.jhu.zpalmer2.spring2009.ai.hw6.util.ReinforcementLearningUtilities

  • public class ReinforcementLearningUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a catch-all for static functionality.

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomStartingState

        public static State getRandomStartingState(WorldMap world)
        Generates a random starting state for the provided world. This function is not included in the WorldMap class to prevent it from being coupled with the concept of a state.
        Parameters:
        world - The world for which a random starting state is desired.
        Returns:
        A random starting state for that world.

      • renderSimulationStep

        public static java.lang.String renderSimulationStep(WorldMap worldMap,
                                    SimulationStep step)
        Retrieves a string which represents a full simulation display. It includes a display of the world map, state information, and an indicator on the map of the agent's location.
        Parameters:
        worldMap - The map to use.
        step - The simulation step containing the information to render.
        Returns:
        The resulting string.

      • pairPlus

        public static Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> pairPlus(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> a,
                                                 Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> b)
        Adds the values of two integer pairs.
        Parameters:
        a - The first pair.
        b - The second pair.
        Returns:
        The resulting pair.

      • pairPlusMaxAbs

        public static Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> pairPlusMaxAbs(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> a,
                                                       Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> b,
                                                       int m)
        Creates a pair for which each component is the integer sum of the other two pairs bounded by an absolute value maximum.
        Parameters:
        a - The first pair.
        b - The second pair.
        m - The maximum.
        Returns:
        The resulting pair.
